name: biomni-simulate-protein-signaling-network
title: Biomni: Simulate Protein Signaling Network
description: Simulate protein signaling network dynamics using ODE-based logic modeling with normalized Hill functions
content:
Overview

Simulate protein signaling network dynamics using ODE-based logic modeling with normalized Hill functions. This tool models signal transduction cascades by representing protein activation, inhibition, and regulatory interactions using differential equations, enabling prediction of cellular responses to external stimuli and signaling perturbations.

Input Parameters

  • network_structure (dict, required): Network topology defining protein-protein interactions, activations, and inhibitions
  • reaction_params (dict, required): Kinetic parameters for each signaling reaction (rate constants, Hill coefficients)
  • species_params (dict, required): Parameters for each protein species (initial concentrations, degradation rates)
  • simulation_time (float, optional): Total simulation time in arbitrary time units (default: 100)
  • time_points (int, optional): Number of time points to record (default: 1000)

Input Format

{
  "network_structure": {
    "nodes": ["Receptor", "MAPK", "ERK", "TF"],
    "edges": [["Receptor", "MAPK", "activation"], ["MAPK", "ERK", "activation"], ["ERK", "TF", "activation"]]
  },
  "reaction_params": {
    "Receptor_activation": {"k_on": 0.1, "k_off": 0.01, "hill_n": 2},
    "MAPK_activation": {"k_cat": 1.0, "Km": 0.5}
  },
  "species_params": {
    "Receptor": {"initial": 1.0, "degradation": 0.01},
    "MAPK": {"initial": 0.5, "degradation": 0.05}
  },
  "simulation_time": 100,
  "time_points": 1000
}

Biological Use Case

This tool enables systems biology analysis of signaling pathways including:

  • Modeling MAPK/ERK cascades in cell proliferation and differentiation
  • Simulating PI3K/AKT signaling in cell survival and metabolism
  • Analyzing JAK/STAT pathways in cytokine signaling and immune responses
  • Studying Wnt/Î²-catenin signaling in development and cancer
  • Investigating crosstalk between multiple signaling pathways
  • Predicting responses to pathway inhibitors in drug development
  • Understanding signal amplification, ultrasensitivity, and switch-like behaviors
  • Analyzing feedback loops and oscillatory dynamics in signaling networks

Output

The simulation provides:

  • Time-course dynamics of protein activation states
  • Temporal profiles showing signal propagation through the network
  • Steady-state activation levels of all network components
  • Response curves to varying input signal strengths
  • Sensitivity analysis identifying key regulatory nodes
  • Bifurcation analysis for multi-stable signaling states

Results are saved to 'signaling_network_results.txt' in the specified output directory.

Category

systems_biology
